summary:
New Spain was a big part of the Spanish Empire in North and South America. It started in 1521 after the Spanish conquered the Aztec Empire. The capital was Mexico City, built on the old Aztec capital. Spain controlled a lot of land here, including Mexico, parts of the USA, Central America, and even places in Asia like the Philippines.

In the 1500s, they found silver, which made New Spain very important and rich. But in the 1800s, there were problems. Napoleon invaded Spain, causing a crisis. This led to Mexico's independence in 1821, and the end of the viceroyalty.
title: New Spain
